description:
This module aims to develop students’ understanding of Japan's external relations with other nations in Asia and the Pacific. Students will learn about the most contemporary issues in Japanese external relations, place them in a modern historical context, and analyze them with theoretical frameworks and
political concepts. The topics include the Japan‐U.S. security alliance, historical problems related to Yasukuni Shrine and history textbooks, ODA and PKO, territorial disputes, as well as Japan’s commitment to regional institutions in the Asia‐Pacific.
title: Japan and the Asia-Pacific Region
